block.p: An article in Business Day on Thursday about a British trademark suit against Apple Computer referred imprecisely to the ability of the Apple iPod to play tunes from online music stores other than Apple's, an issue in a French political debate. (The error also occurred on March 17 in an article about the French debate.) While Apple's music store makes tunes available in a proprietary format, iPods can play music purchased at certain other stores, usually in MP3 format.
